alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Dickinson, north central Menominee and southern Marquette Counties through 345 PM EDT/245 PM CDT/... At 311 PM EDT/211 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Foster City, or 18 miles northeast of Iron Mountain, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Dickinson, north central Menominee and southern Marquette Counties, including the following locations... Northland, Hardwood and Arnold. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
